intro: Calophysa tococoidea, commonly known as the Tococoidean fern, is a species of fern belonging to the family Blechnaceae. It is characterized by its delicate fronds that are typically bipinnate, with a distinctive arrangement of pinnae and pinnules. The plant is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly in countries such as Brazil and Peru. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in humid forests and along stream banks. Its unique morphology and ecological role make it an important component of its native ecosystem.
